member.name: DVTARGETDEVICE
member.summary: Specifies information about the target device for which data is being composed. DVTARGETDEVICE contains enough information about a Windows target device so a handle to a device context (HDC) can be created using the function.

member.name: DVTARGETDEVICE.tdSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the DVTARGETDEVICE structure. The initial size is included so the structure can be copied more easily.

member.name: DVTARGETDEVICE.tdDriverNameOffset
member.summary: The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the structure to the device driver name, which is stored as a NULL-terminated string in the tdData buffer.

member.name: DVTARGETDEVICE.tdDeviceNameOffset
member.summary: The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the structure to the device name, which is stored as a NULL-terminated string in the tdData buffer. This value can be zero to indicate no device name.

member.name: DVTARGETDEVICE.tdPortNameOffset
member.summary: The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the structure to the port name, which is stored as a NULL-terminated string in the tdData buffer. This value can be zero to indicate no port name.

member.name: DVTARGETDEVICE.tdExtDevmodeOffset
member.summary: The offset, in bytes, from the beginning of the structure to the structure retrieved by calling DocumentProperties.

member.name: DVTARGETDEVICE.tdData
member.summary: An array of bytes containing data for the target device. It is not necessary to include empty strings in tdData (for names where the offset value is zero).
